channel.title: Computational Cancer Analysis Laboratory on UCSD CCAL
channel.description: Recent content in Computational Cancer Analysis Laboratory on UCSD CCAL

item.title: A Plain Markdown Post
item.description: This is a post written in plain Markdown (*.md) instead of R Markdown (*.Rmd). The major differences are: You cannot run any R code in a plain Markdown document, whereas in an R Markdown document, you can embed R code chunks (```{r}); A plain Markdown post is rendered through Blackfriday, and an R Markdown document is compiled by rmarkdown and Pandoc. There are many differences in syntax between Blackfriday’s Markdown and Pandoc’s Markdown.

item.title: Contact Us
item.description: Pablo Tamayo Prinicpal Investigator ptamayo@ucsd.edu William Kim Prinicpal Investigator wkim@ucsd.edu Kate Medetgul-Ernar Web Designer & Content Creator kcniklason@ucsd.edu Locations Center for Novel Therapeutics 9310 Athena Circle Suite 3400 UCSD Moores Cancer Center 3855 Health Sciences Drive Suites 3017 & 3006A

item.title: Contact Us
item.description: UCSD School of Medicine The CTD2 Center at the University of California San Diego (UCSD) aims to identify oncogenic cell states and characterize the most salient genomic and immune hallmarks to infer optimal combinations of pharmacologic and immunological perturbagens. Learn More

item.title: CTD2
item.description: The CTD2 Center at the University of California San Diego (UCSD) aims to identify oncogenic cell states and characterize the most salient genomic and immune hallmarks to infer optimal combinations of pharmacologic and immunological perturbagens. Learn More

item.title: Resources
item.description: Setup Computational Environment Get CCAL Codebase Workflows These workflows are used and updated regularly by the CCAL team. Please use Github Issues for questions or problems that arise when running them. Works in Progress Model and Infer Select features most useful for data decomposition, decompose data into NMF factors, define data states, annotate data states and factors, and visualize annotated factors and states on a map.

item.title: Team
item.description: Team Members Pablo Tamayo Director UCSD Center for Cancer Target Discovery and Development (CTD2) Group Leader, Computational Cancer Analysis Laboratory (CCAL) Co-Director, Genomics and Computational Biology Shared Resource (GCBSR) Professor, Division of Medical Genetics, UC San Diego School of Medicine Visiting Scientist, Cancer Program, Broad Institute of MIT/Harvard William J. Kim Co-Director, UCSD Center for Cancer Target Discovery and Development (CTD2) Assistant Professor, Division of Medical Genetics, UC San Diego School of Medicine Visiting Scientist, Cancer Program, Broad Institute of MIT/Harvard Elizabeth Brunk Cancer Therapeutics Postdoctoral Fellow Suzie Hight Postdoctoral Scholar Kim Lab Xiaojun Max Xu Research Data Scientist Computational Oncologist Alex Wenzel Graduate Student Mesirov Lab Adam Officer Graduate Student Stephanie Ting Research Data Scientist Bioinformatician Jack Niklason Data Analyst Kate Medetgul-Ernar Data Analyst Web Designer John Jun Undergraduate Student Benjamin Pham Undergraduate Student Jiaqian Zhong Undergraduate Student Kwat Medetgul-Ernar Lead Software Engineer Alumni Emily Addleson Maryam Bainazar Kathyrn Berkey Gyan Bhanot Benjamin Briggs Niccolò Bruciaferri Taylor Cavazos Katherine Chen Arnav Choudhury Josh Goodman Samantha Hoffman Lilith Huang John Jun Justin Kane-Starr Adam Klie Nina Ly Andrew M.
